title: (x) "Rich" modern serif - Century 725 (Madison) Cond {Mike Y}
content:
Can anyone help id the font used on “Rich”?

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [txt-card.gif](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=txt-card.gif) | 29.02 KB |
author: henand

comments.content: Originally thought a Bodoni or a Didone but am now thinking it’s some form of Century - am looking for exact match
Yikes - my first double post on the new site! Anyone else finding the site maddeningly slow the last few days?

I think you’re right about its Century-ness. Nick Shinn’s Worldwide is a close match.

http://www.shinntype.com/  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/worldwide/](http://web.archive.org/web/20060207030656/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/worldwide/)

Looks very close to Modern 20 — [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/modern-no-20/](http://web.archive.org/web/20060207030656/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/modern-no-20/) — slightly squooshed.

My vote is [Century 725 (a.k.a. Madison) Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20060207030656/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/century-725/condensed/).

- Mike Yanega
